column4: Why is every application that I open linked to the top panel and I cannot move them?  Where is the menu bar and the X button to close the app??
Your window manager has crashed
waaah ?
try running "metacity --replace"
you have got to be kidding me this is included by defualt now?
Not my choice ;)
ok so I did that then exited the terminal now it is really crashed and I cannot type anything
Why did you close the terminal?
umm the real question is why do I have to keep my window manager alive in a temrinal
alt+F2 and run "metacity --replace"
yeah i did that... Window manager error: Unable to open X display
Not ctrl+alt+F2 :)
alt+f2 in gnome brings up a run dialog
alt+f2 does nothing for me
no wonder this channel is so busy....  I guess i'll go install xfce now
Ok, then in a console (ctrl+alt+F1-6 ) run "DISPLAY=":0" metacity --replace
You could also just restart X
are u sure about those quotes
Yes
if I type it in like you said the quotes do not match up
Well, don't actually type the first one ;) My bad
but anyways I get the idea...   Window manager error: Unable to open X display :0
this is not worth debugging.  I have to go install a more reliable wm now :/
Just disable compiz
yeah that how
System -> Preferences -> Appearance
the menu is not responding... how do i restart X nowadays
ctrl+alt+backspace
is there any way I can permanently have sudo access?  I am freaking tired of typing in my password everytime I want to run synaptic
sudo -s
Or if you are going to be running GUI applications it's probably better to do "gksudo gnome-terminal"
if this pos locks up one more time i'm reformatting the drive and reinstalling feisty
Just disable compiz
I can't I have to reboot again
What do you mean?
I was in the middle of synaptic install and it locked up again so now I have to reboot and fix the packages
i'm emailing shuttlesworth.  this is so not worth it for fancy effects
I ran sudo -s   but it still asks me for the password for everything
You need to run programs from that terminal for them to run as root
but what if I click on the menu, like for Synaptic.  nobody else touches this computer so why do I have to type in my password if I want to change the clock settings
same reason you need to in OSx and Vista, security
but doesn't it just touch a .password file somewhere?
What do you mean?
I mean like how can I fake it out so it does not ask me anymore
That is not a good idea
You would basically have all the security of windows XP if you did that
so it is possible then how do I do it
Basically just set the timeout for sudo to be ~ 1 hour or something
Because that also lets any exploit in FF take control of your entire system
now that I disabled the appearance settings, it boots to the login screen then shuts off the monitors
You are using a 32 bit kernel, you need the server or x86 kernel to see all 4 GIG
where is this documented ??
I meant 64 bit, not x86
I really do not believe that is true where does it say that
It's true of all operating systems :)
no!  32bit architecture can have 4G of ram!
Yes, but not with a standard kernel, that is why 32 bit XP cannot see >3GIG either
Install 64 bit Ubuntu or install the "linux-server" package, I don't know if the proprietary GFX drivers work with the server version though
my cpu and motherboard are not 64bit
Don't know if someone has already answered you yet, but to see all 4 GIG run "sudo apt-get install linux-server"
Did you ever disable compiz?
how can I get pure gnome without metacity or compiz ?
You can't have gnome without a window manager, simplest thing to do would be to have "yourWMofchoice --replace" as a session startup
how do I make it gnome and not metacity by default
I missed your problem what started all of this
what is wrong with the dpkg
Nothing, it's just apt that's borkd
I'm going to try to get back into gnome...
Tem,  if you kill metacity from the command and replace it, you will see error messages.  Maybe this is why it is freezing:     "$ metacity --replace
Tem, my machine survived for an hour in icewm, and I can play full screen graphics on dual monitors and the graphics card is fine.  but the default metacity... it doesn't survive at all
opening firefox with metacity freezes almost immediately.
he is romanian.  He wants to ssh from one computer to the other.  He has openssh server installed, but he has no IP.  he needs to get that machine an IP from his router
That machine being the one he is trying to ssh into ?
yeah he's in ubuntu server but he has no IP
then he needs to ping that ip from the other machine, and ssh to it
Has he tried "sudo ifconfig eth0 && sudo dhclient eth0" ?
it took me this long to figure out what he is asking.  gotta go eat lunch
he just needs to get that computer online then he will be able to ssh  to it
ifconfig eth0 up u mean
Yes, thank you
Has it always done this?
why doesn't it give an error or something?  I reinstalled grub from the livecd, I fixed the UUID, all the tricks I know
I don't know, you might try grub2
9.10 has pcspkr blacklisted by default
